answers.answer: It's pretty common for some of the measurements to be off by a few weeks and this certainly doesn't indicate a problem.If you had gestational diabetes your sugar levels would be high.  The fact that family members have type ii diabetes has no bearing on whether you might develop gestational diabetes since type ii diabetes is caused by lifestyle choices.

question: At my 21 week scan, the babys abdominal circum. was measuring about 2 weeks larger.  All the other measurements agreed with the 21 weeks.  There is a history of diabetes in my family (father type2, maternal grandmother type 2) . This is my second pregnancy, had the glucose tolerance test on my first pregnancy and was neg.  My son was born 7lb 2oz, so normal weight.   I am thirsty alot.  I did a blood sugar test with my dads home kit at 21 weeks and it was very low, 2.3mmol, had not eaten for few hours, and after a biscuit it was normal 5.1mmol an hour later.  I know the GTT is done after 24 weeks, and will get my doc to do it then, but I am worried sick over all this.  Would it not be the case my blood sugar should be high if gest diabetes is developing?  Is it common enough for any measurements on an ultrasound to be larger with no complications?  ThanksThis discussion is related to/posts/show/1256538.
title: Baby abdomen measuring large
